He informed the people that he admitted as much in the court where the chief minister has filed a defamation suit against him. He said he was ready to prove the charge with hard evidence.</font><font size=""4"" face=""times new roman
column4: serif"">

column2: sans-serif;""><font size=""4"" face=""times new roman
column3: serif"">As for the accusation of "spreading anarchy"
column4: he said it was in the houses of the corrupt people that this anarchy was going to spread. "For the people
column5: there is no choice. It''s a fight between the right and the wrong. If this is anarchy
column6: so be it."</font><font size=""4"" face=""times new roman
column7: serif"">

column2: sans-serif;""><font size=""4"" face=""times new roman
column3: serif"">The number of Delhi''ites who have consented to not paying their water and electricity bills has crossed 1 lakh 12 thousand on the second day of the hunger strike
column4: it was announced in the beginning of today''s meet-the-people session. "The Government
column5: that was so far apathetic to appeals of the people
column6: is now bewildered why Arvind Kejriwal was not asking for anything from it

column8: serif"">

column2: sans-serif;""><font size=""4"" face=""times new roman
column3: serif"">Vinod Kumar Binny
column4: the independent councillor of the Municipal Corporation of East Delhi who has recently joined the AAP. announced to hold mohalla sabhas every month for decentralised governance
column5: in his ward.</font><font size=""4"" face=""times new roman
column6: serif"">

column2: sans-serif;""><font size=""4"" face=""times new roman

He said the problem of the people was the same across the country; there was no difference in the level of corruption in Delhi and Sikkim. So he requested the movement called AAP to reach out to the entire geographical stretch of the country to fight injustice.</font><font size=""4"" face=""times new roman
column4: serif"">

column2: sans-serif;"">The Civil Disobedience movement against illegitimate bijli-pani bills launched by Aam Aadmi Party is gaining momentum with each passing day in Delhi. By the end of the third day i.e. March 25th

column2: sans-serif;""><span style=""text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Delhi | 26 March: Addressing the people on the fourth day of the
column4: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify;"">satyagraha
column5: sans-serif;""> against unfair rate of water and electricity
column6: Arvind Kejriwal said his health deteriorated since yesterday’s speech and
column7: hence
column8: he would speak less this time. Assuring the people at large
column9: however
column10: he proclaimed
column12: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt; text-align: justify;"">Sharir kamzor zaroor hai
column13: magar hausle buland hain
column14: sans-serif;"">(I am only physically weak; my spirit has not dampened)."

column2: sans-serif;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">In the evening
column4: his Blood Pressure was 114/70
column5: Pulse was 75 and Sugar was 85. He has lost 5 kg of body weight in the last four days
column6: Kejriwal’s medical team informed.

column2: sans-serif;""><span style=""text-align: justify; font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">By the end of Day 3
column4: i.e. March 25th
column5: 186697 satyagrahis had signed protest letters to Shiela Dikshit pledging that they would not pay the inflated bijli-pani bills.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; text-align: start;"">Today
column4: general secretary of Delhi Resident Welfare Association Federation — an association of 51 RWAs under its fold — DC Prajapati pledged the support of the outfit to the indefinite fast for people’s cause. He said he would be getting the protest letters addressed to Shiela Dikshit signed by people living in these areas.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; text-align: start;"">As the day progresses
column4: residents of Sunder Nagari would light a huge pyre of inflated bijli-pani bills at around 7pm. On the eve of Holika dahan
column5: hundreds of people would assemble near F-Block in Sundar Nagari. ((Photographs of the same would be made available on the website: www.aamaadmiparty.org))

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; text-align: start;"">On stage
column4: family members of one Rasida Begum
column6: who lives in a one room shanty in Inderlok with her handicapped son came to complain she has received an inflated bill of Rs 1
column8: 868. She has a question to ask Delhi Chief Minister Shiela Dikshit
column9: "My handicapped son and I are unemployed. I paid Rs 15
column10: 000 last year after taking a loan. How can I pay this bill of over 1 lakh?"

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;""><span style=""text-align: start;"">Ram Kishori is a widow who lives in Dwarka Phase 3. She works as a domestic help to make her ends meet. She had received a bill of Rs 53
column4: 000. On non-payment of the bill
column5: her supply of electricity to her house was disconnected. She asks
column6: "I am a widow
column7: how can I pay this bill with my meagre income?"<br style=""text-align: start;"" />

column1: 18-year old Neha''s father is a scrap dealer. He barely manages to feed six mouths with a measly income of Rs 5
column2: 000 a month. The family has received an electricity bill of about Rs 2
column3: 500. Neha asks
column4: "If my father pays Rs 2
column5: 500 for electricity
column6: what will our family eat; how will we study?"

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; text-align: start;"">Inviting all such victims of the Delhi Government-discoms nexus on stage or hearing patiently their tales of woes outside
column4: AAP activist Manish Sisodia said that there were only two ways the ruling class ensures its rule lasts for ever: instilling fear and greed in the minds of the people; “greed in a few
column5: and fear in most”. The need of the hour is to get over the fear of oppression by the ruling class
column6: he said while informing the audience that the government
column7: which has started feeling the heat of the movement
column8: has started misusing the police to scare activists of the AAP. Posters
column9: hoardings
column10: banners and other publicity material of the party are being pulled down from across the city
column11: and volunteers are being manhandled by the police
column12: Sisodia informed.

column2: sans-serif;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Taking a cue from this speech
column4:
activist Gopal Rai urged the people to die for the country rather than live wretchedly like animals.

column1: 86;"2.69 lakh Protest Letters to Sheila Dikshit Signed; Arvind Kejriwal''s Health Deteriorates
column2: Ketone Level Reach 4+";"<span style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Arvind Kejriwal''s health might be deteriorating
column4: but his spirits are high due to the vast support that Civil Disobedience movement against illegitimate bijli-pani bills is getting in Delhi. People have started to quit their fear and stand up against illegitimate bills in the National capital.<br style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column5: sans-serif;"" />

column2: sans-serif;"" />

82726 people pledged not to pay the unfair bills - the highest in one day so far. The greater part of the support is coming from North East and North West Delhi. The total number of bijli-pani satyagrahis in Delhi has now reached 2
column4: 423. These letters would be delivered across to Shiela Dikshit shortly.<br style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column5: sans-serif;"" />

column2: sans-serif;"" />

thousands of volunteers working day and night in different wards of Delhi would come to meet Arvind Kejriwal and other AAP leaders at 4pm in Sundar Nagri.<br style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"" />

column2: sans-serif;"" />

column1: Arvind Kejriwal''s health meanwhile has deteriorated further. His blood pressure is 114/70
column2: Pulse 74 and Sugar 108. His weight has fallen from 65kgs on day 1 and is now 59.5 kgs. The Ketone in his urine sample is 4+
column3: according to the medical team.

column2: ghar ghar pahuchegi: Arvind Kejriwal";"
column3: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 12pt;""><font face=""Calibri"">On the sixth Day of <i>upwas
column4: Arvind Kejriwal addressing the crowd at Sundar Nagri said he is perfectly fine and would continue his fight against inflated bijli-pani bills till the people of Delhi quit their fear and become united. He said
column5: “<i>jab sache dil se dua nikalti hai
column6: apne aap ghar-ghar
column7: har dil tak pahuch jati hai. Aur mera dil ki awaaz kehti hai ki desh zaroor badlega.”

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">
sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 12pt;""><font face=""Calibri"">He said
column3: several people are asking why there has been no reaction from BJP and Congress on the issue so far. This he said was because the BJP and Congress are both worried as a different kind of politics is slowly emerging in India. So far they are used to winning on the basis of bribing the voters
column4: money power and muscle power but now the voters have awakened. He said
column5: “<i>Agla chunav
column6: chunav nahi kranti hoga.”

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 12pt;""><font face=""Calibri"">Adding to this
column3: farmer leader Gurnam Singh said
column4: if the oppressed farmers in Haryana have refused to pay their electricity bills for the past 14 years
column5: why can’t delhi-ites stand up against illegitimate bills. Manish Sisodia quoted another example saying 800 villages in Madhya Pradesh have stopped paying their bills when the prices were substantially hiked. All these andolans would soon unite and give way for a better future.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">
sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 12pt;"">Arvind Kejriwal’s health is stable as of now with all the vital parameters within the normal range. Today morning
column3: his Blood Pressure was 120/74
column4: Pulse was 66 and Sugar was 106. The level of ketones has come down from 4+ to 3+
column5: which is a positive indication. However
column6: he has lost 6 kgs of weight so far since his fast begun on March 23rd.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">

sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">Nearly 2500 volunteers had come to meet Arvind Kejriwal and other leaders in Sunder Nagri on the eve of Holi yesterday. After going back they started work with more vigour.

sans-serif; margin: 1em 0cm; text-align: justify;"">Nearly 3000 volunteers have vowed to turn their homes into asahyog kendras. Protest letters addressed to Shiela Dikshit would be available at their homes. People can register their protest at these kendras as well. This is in addition to 264 asahyog kendras that are functional since Day 1. Nutun a volunteer whose house would be one such Kendra said
column3: “My mother and sister-in-law will sit in front of our home with the letters and persuade people not to pay their inflated bijli-pani bills.”

column2: sans-serif; margin: 1em 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 12pt;""><font face=""Times New Roman"">Another such effort is a moving satyagrah Kendra in Mundka region in North-West Delhi. The Kendra
column3: mounted on a tractor
column4: moves around the area reaching out to people
column5: mostly villagers. The Kendra manages to collect an average of 250 protest letters each day.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 1em 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 12pt;""><font face=""Times New Roman""> The response of people has also been very heart-warming so far. In Karawal Nagar
column3: a policeman not only pledged his support but also contributed two days to the aandolan by going door to door creating awareness about the collusion of Shiela Dikshit Government with Private companies.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: calibri
column3: sans-serif;""><font size=""3"">So far
column4: a team of nearly 7000 volunteers are working tirelessly all across Delhi. From today a cadre of around 500 volunteers from neighbouring states of Rajasthan
column5: UP and Haryana would pour in to support the existing volunteer base.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: calibri
column3: sans-serif;"">

column1: 88;"Press Update: One lakh more people vow not to pay inflated bills yesterday
column2: numbers touch 3.75 mark";"<span style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">As Arvind Kejriwal''s upwas enters 7th day
column4: the Civil Disobedience movement launched by Aam Aadmi Party has started to touch the hearts and minds of Delhi-ites. People have started flocking satyagrah kendras all across Delhi to sign the protest letters to Shiela Dikshit while pledging not to pay their inflated bijli-paani bills. They are even volunteering to spread the message among others in the Capital.<br style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column5: sans-serif;"" />

column2: sans-serif;"" />
nearly one lakh more people expressed their solidarity to the movement. By the end of the day yesterday
column3: i.e. March 28th
column4: 100396 more people pledged not to pay the inflated bills taking the total to 3
column6: 040. Day before yesterday
column7: on the eve of Holi
column8: despite the festivities
column9: several people came out in support of the movement and roughly 6000 people pledged not to pay the bills.<br style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column10: sans-serif;"" />

column2: sans-serif;"" />
the number of people whom the movement would touch is expected to increase exponentially. Nearly 3000 volunteers would turn their homes to mini asahyog kendras
column3: in addition to 264 asahyog kendras that already existed. The protest letters would be available at their homes as well. In addition to that
column4: a workforce of nearly 500 volunteers have come to Delhi from neighboring states of UP
column5: Rajasthan
column6: MP
column7: Haryana etc. A rickshaw campaign would also be launched in all the wards to increase visibility.<br style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column8: sans-serif;"" />

column2: sans-serif;"" />

column1: Meanwhile Arvind Kejriwal''s health has stabilized. His Blood Pressure is 108/66
column2: Pulse 67
column3: Sugar 123 and weight is 59 kgs. The level of ketones has come down as well from 3+ yesterday to 2+.

column2: JM Lyngdoh and several eminent personalities express support to bijli-pani aandolan in Delhi";"<div style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Several eminent people have expressed their support to the Civil Disobidience movement against illegitimate bijli-pani bills launched by Arvind Kejriwal.

column2: sans-serif;"">

column5: Dr. P.M. Bhargava (former Vice Chair of National Knowledge Commission)

column7: M.P)

column12: Dr. Binayak Sen

column2: sans-serif;"">
sans-serif;"">Please find below the statement:
sans-serif;"">

Arvind Kejriwal has been sitting on an indefinite fast to urge the citizens of Delhi to participate in a new Civil Disobedience Movement. He is urging the people of Delhi not to pay their electricity and Water bills
column3: because they are highly inflated on account of corruption.

column1: He has made public disclosures with documentary evidence detailing how unjustifiably electricity tariffs are being imposed on the people by private electricity distributing companies who are inflating their costs by buying equipment at highly inflated prices from sister companies; showing reduced recovery from consumers; and by selling excess electricity at artificially reduced rates to sister companies. See http://aamaadmiparty.org/PolKhol/Electricity.aspx;http://aamaadmiparty.org/PolKhol/WaterBillsSkyrocketing.aspx

When pleas to stop this corruption fell on deaf ears that Arvind Kejriwal has called for civil disobedience by asking the people of Delhi to refuse to pay the unjust portion of their water and electricity bills till CAG audits are instituted
column2: in both Water and Electricity distribution in Delhi and the tariffs are brought down to reasonable levels. Gandhiji had said that when the laws and the rules are highly unjust and oppressive then it is not only the right but the duty of the citizens to refuse to obey such laws and rules. The citizen of Delhi
column3: most of who struggle to make the two ends meet and who simply cannot afford the hiked bills
column4: seek to follow this duty and exercise their right to disobey. They seek to do so in a non-violent manner and are willing to face the consequences including penalties and punitive action.

column2: we extend our support to this call for civil disobedience. We also urge the Delhi government and other public authorities to take note of the irregularities brought to notice by this movement and take urgent corrective action.

column1: Hindi Translation of the statement (The document was originally in English)

अरविन्द केजरीवाल बिजली पानी के मुद्दों पर सविनय अवज्ञा और असहयोग आन्दोलन का आह्वान करते हुए 23 मार्च से अनिश्चितकालीन उपवास पर हैं। दिल्ली में बिजली-पानी के बिल निजी कंपनियों और सरकार की मिली-भगत से बढ़ाये गए है।

<div>अरविन्द केजरीवाल ने दस्तावेज़ों के जरिये ये खुलासा किया भी किया है। ये कंपनियां बिजली उपकरण अपनी ही सहयोगी कंपनियों से ऊंचे दामों पर खरीद रही है और इससे होने वाले नुकसान की भरपाई लोगों के बिल बढ़ाकर की जा रही है
column2: बिजली बिलों के भुगतान से हुई कमाई को कम करके दिखाया जा रहा है और अतिरिक्त बिजली को अपनी ही कंपनियों को कम दाम पर बेचकर बनावटी नुकसान दिखाया जा रहा है। (जानकारी के लिए : http://aamaadmiparty.org/PolKhol/Electricity.aspx; http://aamaadmiparty.org/PolKhol/WaterBillsSkyrocketing.aspx)

column1: इस अंधी लूट पर सत्ता पक्ष और निजी कंपनियों के इस भ्रष्ट गठबंधन पर विपक्ष भी बरसो से चुप्पी साधे था। इस निर्मम लूट पर अकेले पड़े आम आदमी का मनोबल बढ़ने के लिए सितम्बर में आम आदमी से आवाहन किया था कि बिजली पानी दिल्ली की जनता का है इसलिए ये नाजायज़ बिल देने बंद किये जाये.

जब इस भ्रष्टाचार को रोकने की हर कोशिश बेकार रही तो अरविन्द केजरीवाल ने असहयोग आन्दोलन शुरू कर दिल्ली के लोगों से अपील की कि वो बिजली और पानी के नाजायज़ बिल तब तक न भरें जब तक बिजली और पानी की सप्लाई में हुए घोटाले की CAG से जांच न कराई जाय और बिजली के बढ़े हुए दामों को कम करके जायज़ स्तर पर नहीं लाया जाए। गाँधी जी ने कहा था कि जब नियम और कानून नाजायज़ और आम लोगों को दमन करने वाले हों तो ये जनता का अधिकार भी है और कर्तव्य भी है कि वो ऐसे नियम और कानूनों को मानने से इंकार कर दें। दिल्ली की जनता पहले ही महंगाई की मार झेल रही है और बढ़े हुए बिल चुकाने में असमर्थ हैं इसलिए उन्हें भी कानून की अवमानना के अपने अधिकार का इस्तेमाल करना चाहिए। जनता अपने इस अधिकार का इस्तेमाल अहिंसात्मक तरीके से कर रही है और इसके नतीजे और जुर्माना भुगतने के लिए तैयार है।

इन परिस्तिथियों में हम इस असहयोग आन्दोलन को अपना समर्थन देते हैं। हम दिल्ली सरकार और सम्बंधित विभागों से मांग करते हैं कि इस आन्दोलन के जरिये सामने लाई गई बिजली और पानी के बिलों की समस्या पर ध्यान दें और उन्हें सुधारने की दिशा में तुरंत कार्यवाही करें।

column2: "" /></div></div>";"2013-03-29 16:32:35";"2013-03-29 00:00:00";"2013-06-25 00:00:00";

column1: 90;"ARVIND KEJRIWAL DARES SHIELA DIKSHIT FOR AN OPEN DEBATE";"
column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; text-align: start;"">Addressing the crowd assembled in Sunder Nagri on the 7th day of upwas
column4: Arvind Kejriwal said the prices of power and water in Delhi had gone up many times because of corruption of Sheila Dikshit Government. Responding to the allegation made by Delhi Chief Minister that people can’t use 24 hours power supply and pay only for 8 hours
column5: Arvind Kejriwal challenged Shiela Dikshit for an open debate anywhere anytime in front of the people of Delhi. He said he would prove on the basis of documents that the claim made by Shiela Dikshit is false and misleading
column6: and massive corruption of her government is the root cause of inflated bills.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">He said
column4: yesterday some employees of Delhi Jal Board had come to meet him. They informed that Shiela Dikshit had recently signed contracts with foreign water treatment companies Veolia and Dregmont. According to the contract
column5: thousands of litres of water is being supplied either free or at a nominal cost of Re 1 by her to these companies. He said
column6: if that water is given to people of Delhi instead of these foreign firms
column7: the water bills could even come down by Rs 5 per month per family. He said
column8: “It is unfortunate that Sheila Dikshit can give thousands of water to these private companies
column9: but not to people of Delhi at nominal cost."

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Expressing that a new kind of politics is emerging in the country
column4: he said
column5: "<i>Upwas bahut pavitra cheez hai
column6: aandolan bhi pavitra cheez hai. Desh ki raajneeti bahut gandi ho gayi hai. Ye raajneeti bhi is upwas se pavitra hogi."

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">He congratulated the volunteers who had been putting a lot of effort going door-to-door explaining to the people the need for this moment. However
column4: he cautioned them that it is not the numbers that matter but the fact that the fear in the minds of people against the government should be removed.
column5: sans-serif;"">

column2: Manish Sisodia presented a few case studies:
sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">One such is the case of a local temple in Nand Nagri. The temple has no priest or Trust to look into its day-to-day affairs
column4: neither does anyone live in the temple. The people living near the temple have installed a few bulbs for their convenience. The power supply of the temple was cut off a few days back. Interestingly
column5: the power company never bothered to install a meter at the temple. Before disconnecting the power supply
column6: the power discom did give a notice - but in the name of Ram Shankar who lives 400 houses away. They even filed an FIR in his name. The people of the area were initially scared
column7: but now after seeing Arvind Kejriwal''s upwas
column8: 250 people living in this area have decided to write to the discom and police station saying that if installing bulbs at a temple is theft then all of them are together in this and hence FIR should be filed against all of them.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Another person who lives in a small shanty expressing his grief said
column4: I had got a meter installed in 2008. I had been paying all the bills on time since the meter was installed. Recently the power company sent him a bill of 1.5 lakhs for period before 2008 and on non-payment of the same
column5: it disconnected his power supply. He said
column6: “I have 4 children
column7: and they have disconnected my power supply. I have decided that I will not pay the wrong bill.”

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Slowly and gradually the fear in the minds and hearts of Delhiites against unjust bills is disappearing. The movement will soon will touch the hearts of many more. Till Thursday night 3.7 lakh people had decided that they would not pay the bills
column4: and many more would soon follow in the coming days.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">

column1: 91;"अन्ना ने अरविन्द से की मुलाकात और उपस्थित लोगों को संबोधित किया";"<span id="".reactRoot[26].[1][2][1]{comment632022923490844_632040093489127}.0.[1].0.[1].0.[0].[0][2].0.[0]"" style=""color: #333333; font-family: lucida grande
column2: tahoma

column3: sans-serif;""><font size=""3"">Over five lakh people in Delhi have vowed not to pay the inflated bijli-pani bills
column4: as Arvind Kejriwal''s upwas enters the eighth day. The per day figure has continuously increased during the last week. Yesterday itself
column5: i.e. March 29</font><font><sup>th</sup></font><font size=""3"">
column6: 136234 people expressed their solidarity to the Civil Disobedience movement launched by Aam Aadmi Party
column7: touching a total figure of 511274 in the past 7 days.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: calibri
column3: sans-serif;""><font size=""3"">Yesterday
column4: people living in North West Delhi showed the maximum support
column5: followed by North East Delhi - in both these areas more than 25
column6: 000 people pledged not to pay their bills in a single day. Next in line are South Delhi and West Delhi
column7: where more than 20
column8: 000 people in a single day have signed protest letters to Shiela Dikshit.

column3: sans-serif;"">The movement yesterday received a boost when Anna Hazare visited the fasting venue to meet Arvind Kejriwal and his family late in the night.

column3: sans-serif;""><font size=""3"">While enroute to Amritsar
column4: Anna visited Sunder Nagri. Addressing the crowds he said
column5: "<i>Raste alag hai
column6: magar manzil ek hi hai." (Their paths might be different but the goal is the same). He said
column7: Arvind Kejriwal is fighting for the poor people and expressed his concern over inflated bill. He said
column8: “Arvind apne liye kya maang raha hai? Jo garib logo par anyay ho raha hai isko sarkar ko dekhna chahiye. Ek garib aadmi ka 3-4 hazar bill aa gaya to kaha se bharega?” He also said that whenever required he would come together to fight for the country.

column1: 93;"Press Update: Reconnect Power of all those households whose power has been disconnected: Arvind Kejriwal";"On the eighth day of upwas¸ Arvind Kejriwal urged the crowds gathered at Sunder Nagri to reconnect the power supply of all those people whose electricity has been disconnected by the power discoms due to non-payment of bill. He said
column2: “<i>Hum log andhere me kyu rahe? Aaj aap Sunder Nagri ke galiyo me jaana aur puchna kis-kiski bijli kati hai
column3: aur un sabki bijli jod dena.”

column1: The movement launched by Aam Aadmi Party has started having the desired impact on the people of Delhi. Till yesterday evening
column2: more than 5 lakh people of Delhi have pledged to not pay their bills.
several people have started coming to the fore getting rid of their fear of government and private companies. Jal Khore is one such village in Delhi which has around 5000 residents. Ashok Nain
column3: President of the RWA of the village says
column4: “The bill that we started getting is much more than our children’s school fees. That was when we decided that we will not pay the bills.” Today morning
column5: the village panchayat passed an resolution that the entire village will stand up against illegitimate bijli-pani bills and stop paying their bills.

column2: Arvind Kejriwal’s health parameters are within the normal range at the moment. Arvind Kejriwal said Anna Hazare’s visit to Sunder Nagri has lent strength to the movement. He said
column3: “<i>Thori kamzori zaroor hai
column4: par me swasth hun. Annaji ne kaha hai ki jab tak sharir seh tab tak sehan karo.”

column2: in an interesting development
column3: all the three power discoms have come together and issued public advertisements in leading newspapers saying that the price of power in the capital is very less compared to many other cities. The fact is that the cost of electricity in Delhi is going up due to corruption
column4: inflated capital expenditure
column5: increasing Distribution and commercial losses and manipulated loss due to sale of surplus power resulting in fudging of accounts by all three DISCOMs.

column1: The very fact that DISCOMs have been opposing an independent audit by CAG is a proof to the fact that their books have been cooked to cheat Delhi-ites.

column1: The average cost of purchase of power by DISCOMs is some of the states are as follows-
These figures are indicative and bring out that the cheap electricity available to all Discoms across the country.

What is more interesting is that the weighted cost of generation of electricity varied from Rs.1.67/unit ( Pit head generating stations) to Rs.2.82/unit (non pit head generating stations) in 2011 (Source CERC annual report 2010-2011) which has marginally gone up in last 2 years (5-8%) but the increase in tariff in Delhi has been huge i.e. more than 65% which is totally unjustified and criminal.

The revenue gap of Rs.19000/- Crores has been calculated by DERC based on data provided by DISCOMs which itself is questionable as no independent body (CAG) has carried out any audit of DISCOMs. The audit done by private auditors is not reliable as some of these auditors became consultant to DERC as well.

column3: sans-serif;"">Tomorrow

column5: “<i>Aapki sarkar ne Delhi me Bijli aur paani ke bill itne mehnge kar diye hai ki humara ghar chalana mushkil hota ja raha hai. Bhrashtachar ke vajah se badhaye gaye bijli aur pani ke daamo ka main virodh karta/karti hun. Main ekjut ho rahi Delhi ki janta ke is mudde par puri tarah sath hun..Mujhe ummid hai ki janta ki mukhyamantri hone ke naate aap bijli companiyo ka saath dene ke bajay
column6: janta ka sath dena shuru karengi aur bijli ka daam adha karengi.”

column1: 95;"Press Update: Arvind Kejriwal warns Shiela Dikshit not to restrain AAP activists";"
column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">At the end of the 9th day of his upwaas (fast) Arvind Kejriwal today warned Shiela Dikshit not to attempt to stop Aam Aadmi Party Activists from delivering the protest letters of over 7 lakh troubled Delhi citizens tomorrow morning. Aam Aadmi Party volunteers are planning to reach Shiela Dikshit’s residence in a small group of 272
column4: representing each municipal ward of Delhi. Party Activists have intimated Delhi Police that they would peacefully start from Sundar Nagari at 10.30am
column5: in Auto Rickshaws. DCP
column6: North East
column7: denied permission for the same on the grounds that
column8: “so many Auto rickshaws carrying National Flags cannot be allowed”. Though he failed to explain under which law the same was prohibited.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Responding to this unusual interpretation of an unknown law
column4: Arvind Kejriwal said
column5: “Agar <i>DCP sahab ye kehke gaye hai
column6: iska matlab kahin na kahin Shiela Dikshit ko taklif zaroor ho rahi hai. Main Shiela Dikshit ko ye chetaavni dena chahta hun
column7: ki hume rokne ki koshish na kare. Agar koshish karenge to jaha roke hum vahin baith jayenge
column8: tabtak baithe rahenge jabtak vo hume aage jane na de.”

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Arvind Kejriwal said
column4: <i>“Unhone kaha ki Tiranga nahi lagane denge. Jis desh ki sarkar tirange se darti ho
column5: uska kya hoga?”

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Till yesterday night
column4: over 6.3 lakh people had signed letters and vowed not to pay the inflated bills in the national capital. The figure is expected to cross 7 lakhs by tonight.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Arvind Kejriwal also appealed to people to visit Aam Aadmi Party’s Satyagrah Kendras across the capital and register their protest by pledging not to pay their bills. He also asked people to collect the letters from these Kendras and ask more and more people to join the movement.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">On the ninth day of upwas
column4: Arvind Kejriwal’s health parameters are within normal range. In the evening
column5: his blood pressure wass 109/72
column6: Pulse 72
column7: Sugar 112 and Ketones was 3+.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">A silent political revolution has started to take shape in Delhi. The Civil Disobedience movement launched by the Party is slowly spreading its wings across the National Capital. People''s association with the movement is now not limited to just signing protest letters to Shiela Dikshit
column4: but they have started to own up the movement as well.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Outside Hauz Khas metro station
column4: two AAP volunteers were distributing protest letters and explaining the need for civil disobedience movement. Initially
column5: out of curiosity
column6: a few people started assembling there to listen to them. Soon the people assembled there not only vowed to not pay their bills
column7: but some even took the protest letters to convince others not to pay their bills. In little time
column8: two volunteers multiplied into 20.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">There have been numerous instances where people have left their homes
column4: taken leaves from jobs
column5: shut down their shops just to give time for the movement.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">One such person is 35-year old Bhigu Patel who is a volunteer in Tri Nagar area. The enthusiasm of Patel is unmatched. Patel is physically disabled
column4: yet he goes around on his tri-cycle door-to-door creating awareness about the movement. He has installed a loud speaker on his tri-cycle and till date has got around 2000 protest letters signed.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">Support is pouring in from all corners of Delhi. Independent Councillor Naresh Baliyan has come out to express his support. Another Councillor Vinod Kumar Binny
column4: from East Delhi has already joined the party and is working full time with volunteers.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-size: 10pt; font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">

column1: 96;"Press Update: Upwas abhi lamba chalega: Arvind Kejriwal";"
column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">On the 10<sup>th</sup> day of Arvind Kejriwal Upwaas
column4: protest letters signed by 7.92 lakh Delhi-ites would be delivered across to Shiela Dikshit’s residence today. This is probably the first time
column5: when such a large number of people have come forth to register their protest by pledging not to pay the inflated bijli-pani bills. Would Shiela Dikshit listen to the plea of aam aadmi of Delhi now or to Tatas
column6: Ambanis or foreign firms who fill their pockets with money meant for the poor?

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">Yesterday
column4: in a single day
column5: more than 1.5 lakh people pledged their support to civil disobedience movement and vowed not to pay their bills
column6: taking to total to 792665. The movement which started with 7000 volunteer initially
column7: has now multiplied many folds with people owning up the responsibility of getting the letters signed from others.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">Despite extreme weakness
column4: Arvind Kejriwal’s health parameters are in normal range. His Blood Pressure is 109/74
column5: Pulse is 76
column6: Sugar is 128 and Ketones is between 2+ and 3+. When volunteers and people who had gathered there requested him to break his upwas
column7: Arvind Kejriwal said
column8: “<i>Upwas abhi lamba chalega. Ye jo aap log keh rahe hai
column9: ye aapka pyar hai
column10: lekin main ye puchna chahta hun
column11: Bhagat Singh ki zingagi zaroori nahi thi? Subash Chandra Bose ki zindigi zaroori nahi thi kya? Gandhiji ki zindigi zaroori nahi thi kya? Desh zada zaroori hai aur desh ko bachane ke liye zindgi ko daav pe lagana padega. Zindagi ka kya bharosa? Aaj yaha se bahar niklal ke accident ho gaya to
column12: heart attack aa gaya to? Zindgi aapke hath me nahi upar vale ke hath me hai..Me apna khun jalane ko tayar hun

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">Representatives from 272 wards led by Manish Sisodia
column4: Kumar Vishwas and Sanjay Singh in auto rickshaws left for Shiela Dikshit’s residence. They would be delivering the letters written to Shiela Dikshit by people of Delhi. Yesterday
column5: DCP North East
column6: had visited Sunder Nagri and denied permission for the same
column7: in response to which Arvind Kejriwal had dared Shiela Dikshit not to restrain the activists. All the people who would be a part of the procession were advised not to break any laws while proceeding towards Delhi CM’s residence. If the police stops us at any point
column8:
we would peacefully sit there till the time we are allowed to proceed further.

";"2013-04-01 18:48:21";"2013-04-01 00:00:00";"2013-07-05 00:00:00";

column1: 97;"Press Update: Is Shiela Dikshit Scared of Letters Written by 8 lakh Delhi People?";"
column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">The insensitivity of Sheila Dikshit Government towards people of Delhi and their problems become evident today when Delhi Chief Minister refused to accept protest letters written by 8 lakh aam aadmis of Delhi against inflated bijli-pani bills. The activists who went to deliver these letters were not only stopped midway
column4: but the Delhi Police who promised to take them to Shiela Dikshit’s residence
column5: cheated and dropped the activists at Indraprasta metro station.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">Some activists did manage to reach her residence to deliver a few letters. Surprisingly
column4: in no time
column5: these letters were declared as fake. It is surprising to note that Congress which has failed to make any headway in scams that have rocked the nation or get an CAG audit of Discoms who are looting the people in Delhi
column6: could barely in 15 minutes not only go through the letters but also declare them as fake.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">More than 7.92 lakh people had signed these protest letters to Shiela Dikshit till yesterday night
column4: i.e. March 31st. In the letters
column5: Delhi-ites had expressed their agony over inflated bilji-pani bills. Delhi Government which has 49% stake in DERC has however failed to listen to people’s woes.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">In the morning
column4: 272 AAP activists representing 272 municipal wards in Delhi had gone to deliver the letters to Delhi CM
column5: but they were stopped enroute by Delhi Police at Bhairon Marg. The Activists were peacefully moving towards Shiela Dikshit''s residence in auto rickshaws
column6: but were not allowed to move further by Delhi Police which had heavily deployed its personnel on Bhairon Marg. As decided earlier
column7: all activists settled down peacefully there. After talks
column8: Delhi Police agreed to allow 272 representatives of wards for which 4 buses were provided by Police. However
column9: the Police cheated on the people and dropped them at Indraprasta metro instead of Shiela Dikshit’s residence.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">However
column4: this is not going to stop Aam Aadmi Party from fighting against illegitimate bijli-pani bills. Arvind Kejriwal in his address in the morning narrated an incident. A woman who works as a domestic help living in a slum in Delhi received a bill of Rs. 26
column5: 000. When she could not pay the bill
column6: people from the power company came to take away her fridge and TV. The women was left with no option but to beg for money from her neighbours. She finally managed to borrow Rs 16
column7: 000 as loan which she gave to the officials to get her TV and fridge back. Arvind Kejriwal asks
column8: “Kya ek aam aadmi ke ghar se TV aur Fridge utha lejana arajakta nahi hai?”

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><b><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">Totally determined to continue his fight
column4: Arvind Kejriwal said this opportunity to fight against the corrupt has come after many decades
column5: and we may not get another one in many more years to come. He asked the volunteers who had gathered there if they were tired. The volunteers
column6: in reply
column7: ensured him that they would put put in all their efforts to reach out to the maximum number of delhi-ites. He said
column8: “<i>Upwas abhi lamba chalega
column9: thankna nahi hai. Me apna khun jalane ko tayar hun aap apna paseena bahaye.”

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><b><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 10pt;"">

column1: 98;"Some Questions to Shiela Dikshit and Delhi Police";"
column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: calibri
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;"">As Arvind Kejriwal’s upwas enters the eleventh day
column4: the number of bijli-pani satyagrahis who have pledged not to pay the inflated bills has crossed 8.3 lakhs till yesterday night. Unfortunately
column5: the Delhi Chief Minister has little time to listen to the problems faced by aam janta of Delhi
column6: as was evident from yesterday’s incident.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 12pt 0cm; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: calibri
column3: sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;"">The Delhi Government and Delhi Police yesterday betrayed the people of the national capital
column4: when they stopped activists from delivering 7.92 lakh protest letters signed by Delhi-ites. In response to the same
column5: we demand answers for following questions from Shiela Dikshit and Delhi Police:

column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 12pt 36pt; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">1.    If the Civil Disobedience Movement against inflated bijli-pani bills is allegedly spreading “Lawlessness”
column4: then refusing to accept letters written by 8 lakh citizens of Delhi is not “Governance” either. Is this Democracy where citizens cannot write to the government? Even a clerk could have accepted 272 bundles of letters!

column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 12pt 36pt; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">2.    Such intensive efforts were made to in order to stop activists from delivering 8 lakh letters to the Delhi CM! The time of more than 1000 policemen was wasted
column4: traffic arrangements went for a toss. Would it not have been simpler if two clerks were given the responsibility of receiving the 272 bundles of letters? What is the fear in accepting letters from citizens that invites such heavy bandobast?

column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 12pt 36pt; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">3.    At any given point of time
column4: thousands of vehicles ply on the streets of Delhi. What impact would have 272 autos that took off from Sunder Nagri made to the existing traffic? We did not request for any special arrangements or traffic diversions to accommodate these autos. Why such elaborate efforts to stop us?

column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 12pt 36pt; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">4.    Our vehicles could have easily left Sunder Nagri and reached Shiela Dikshit’s residence without any disturbance
column4: had the Delhi Police not created chaos. We were stopped near Pragati Maidan
column5: we were again forced to get down at Ring Road
column6: all this created traffic mayhem. Delhi Police must take responsibility for this foolishness. We would like to remind them that their job is to facilitate citizens to reach their destination
column7: not to stop them.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 12pt 36pt; text-align: justify;""><span style=""font-family: arial
column3: sans-serif;"">5.    It has been reported that Delhi Power Minister Haroon Yusuf has said that “exhorting people not to pay their bills and reconnecting disconnected power supply may create lawlessness”. Does this mean that inflating prices of bijli and pani due to corruption is not akin to creating a lawless situation? And when people protest against the same it is lawlessness?

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span lang=""EN""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">Meanwhile
column3: Arvind Kejriwal’s health is stable at the moment. His Blood pressure is 108/71
column4: Pulse 67
column5: Sugar 123 and Ketone is 3+. Weight could not be checked in the morning.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span lang=""EN""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">Yesterday
column3: the number of people who vowed not to pay their bills increased to 833464.
column4: sans-serif; font-size: 11pt;"">Meanwhile
column5:
many social organizations have expressed their support to the movement. Aruna Roy’s MKSS and NAPM led by Medha Patkar has supported the Civil Disobedience movement.

";"2013-04-02 12:05:32";"2013-04-02 00:00:00";"2013-07-10 00:00:00";

column1: 99;"Update: Discoms should put its collection figures in public domain";"
column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font face=""Calibri""><font size=""3""><font color=""#000000"">As per some media reports
column3: the Discoms in Delhi have claimed that they have recorded no losses in its collection for the month of March so far. If that is the case
column4: then we urge these Discoms to make public all their collections so far. The Discoms should put all their income-expenditure figure in the public domain. If there is no fudging in its accounts
column5: then why are they afraid of getting itself audited by CAG?

column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font color=""#000000""><font face=""Calibri"">The people of Delhi have the right to know how much profit Discoms are making in distributing the electricity. In 2010
column3: Brijender Singh had said that these Discoms are making huge profits. He not only denied them an increase in tariff
column4: but also said that the tariff could be reduced by 23%.

column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;"">All the three discoms should put its collection figures from beginning till date so that people can themselves analyse how much profit or loses the firms are making.
sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;"">

column1: 100;"Day 11 Evening: Who is spreading lawlessness?";"
column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">As the eleventh day of Arvind Kejriwal’s upwas come to an end
column3: Civil Disobedience movement launched by Aam Aadmi Party received tremendous support from all quarters. Till yesterday night
column4: more than 8.3 lakh people had decided not to pay their inflated bijli-pani bills.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">Yesterday
column3: when Aam Aadmi Party activists went to deliver protest letters to Shiela Dikshit
column4: the Delhi Government and Delhi Police betrayed the people by not accepting the protest letters. Delhi Power Minister Haroon Yusuf reacted by saying that “some people are exhorting people not to pay their bills and reconnecting disconnected power supply may create lawlessness.” It is really unfortunate that the power minister of Delhi does not find the corruption by discoms that has led to almost 50% in power as “lawlessness”but when people stand up aagainst corruption that is deemed to be “lawlessness”.Manish Sisodia responded by asking 5 questions to Shiela Dikshit government and Delhi Police. (The same has been emailed earlier)

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri""><span style=""color: #333333;"">The private discoms were also quick to react
column3: by saying that there was no dip in collections for the month of March. If that is the case
column4: then we urge these Discoms to make public all their collections so far. The Discoms should put all their income-expenditure figure in the public domain. If there is no fudging in its accounts
column5: then why are they afraid of getting itself audited by CAG?

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><span style=""color: #333333;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">In the evening
column3: Arvind Kejriwal’s health parameters were within the normal range. His Blood Pressure was 110/69
column4: Pulse was 74
column5: Sugar was 113
column6: Ketone 3+ and weight was 57.5kgs. Because of weakness
column7: he refrained from speaking on the stage today.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">

column1: 101;"CAG Report again Proves that Cong and BJP are ""Dukan"" of Reliance and Adani";"<div class=""MsoNormal"" style=""margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; color: #222222; font-family: arial
column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font face=""Calibri"">
sans-serif;"">No Wonder Why Both Parties are in Favour Of Weak Lokayuktas

sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">The tall claims that Delhi Government had been making regarding development in Delhi has been exposed. The CAG report on performance of Delhi government has brought to front the inefficiency and corruption in managing all the essential services including health
column3: water
column4: housing and security. It also shows the insensitivity of the government towards its citizens. Significant increase in cost of implementation of its programs has also manifested itself in the form of multiple times increase in the cost of electricity and water bills in past few years.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">The report should not be treated just as CAG report but as the agony of common people of Delhi. There is hardly any department
column3: which has remained untouched by corruption and commission raj. The CAG report indicates the same as well. But
column4: what will happen to this report? Would it also be sidelined and put in cold storage like the earlier CAG reports?

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">Though the CAG has unearthed one scam after the other – each one bigger than the earlier – no real investigation has happened due to lack of independent investigation agency. Now that the CAG has exposed Delhi Government
column3: the same question arises here as well. Who would investigate these charges? We are sure that if these serious charges are investigated by an independent investigating agency
column4: not only Sheila Dikshit and her Ministers but also many of her associates would be behind the bars.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">The CAG report has validated that there is large scale corruption in DJB and electricity departments – issues that Aam Aadmi Party has been fighting for. This further asserts the need for a Civil Disobedience movement in Delhi. The CAG report clearly states that Delhi Transco has given undue advantage to private discoms. Even water is a scarce commodity in the capital with almost one fourth of Delhi depending on tanker supply for water. And when residents of Delhi pledge not to pay inflated bills and demand for their rights
column3: it is termed as "spreading lawlessness".

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">As Arvind Kejriwal''s upwas enters the 12th day
column3: more than 8.84 lakh people have signed protest letters to Shiela Dishit saying that they would not be paying inflated bills. Till yesterday night
column4: i.e. April 2nd
column5: around 8
column7: 384 protest letters have been signed. But far from accepting these protest letters
column8: the Delhi Chief Minister uses force on activists to stop them delivering the letters.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">Unfortunately
column3: not only Congress but BJP is also equally involved in the loot. The CAG in its report on Gujarat has clearly stated that Gujarat Chief Minister Narendra Modi has given undue advantage to big corporate houses – Reliance Industries
column4: Essar Ltd and Adani Power Ltd. This has led to losses worth several crores. What is even more surprising is that the report was presented on the last day of the session
column5: so as to avoid furore by the opposition.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><b><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">To save its face from these charges
column3: the Gujarat has recently passed a toothless Lokayukta Bill. If Narendra Modi is seriously thinking on the lines of development of India
column4: he should have set an example in his state. Rather he preferred to pass a weak lokayukta law
column5: which will be nothing but a puppet in the hands of the Government.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">Meanwhile
column3: on the 12th day of upwas
column4: Arvind Kejriwal''s health parameters are within normal range. His Blood Pressure is 107/69
column5: pulse 72
column6: sugar 126

column1: 102;"Press Update: We will restore Bijli-Pani Connections from April 6th: Arvind Kejriwal
-- Shiela Dikshit Government’s duplicity on CAG Audit of Discoms";"
column2: sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;"">As Arvind Kejriwal’s upwas to unite people against illegitimate bijli-pani bills in Delhi entered the 12th day
column3: the next level of the Civil Disobedience Movement was announced here in Sunder Nagri today. As the number of protest letters addressed to Sheila Dikshit approaches the 10-lakh figure
column4: the campaign to restore electricity connection to households whose connection had been disconnected would be intensified from April 6</font><font><sup>th</sup></font><font size=""3""> onwards. On April 6
column6: </font><font><sup> </sup></font><font size=""3"">Gandhiji completed his Dandi Yatra and broke the salt law by making salt from sea water thereby launching the Civil Disobedience movement. On the same day
column7: Aam Aadmi Party volunteers would go door-to-door restoring electricity connections of poor people in Delhi.

column2: sans-serif;"">
sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">Addressing the gathering in Sunder Nagri
column3: Arvind Kejriwal said “<i>April 6
column4: 1930 me Gandhiji ne namak kanoon toda tha
column5: unhi se prerna leke maine ye Asehyog Aandolan shuru kiya. Abhi tak hum logo ke dastakht karva rahe the
column6: 6 April se hum ek kadam aage badhenge. Main Delhi ki janta se appeal karta hun ki puri Delhi me jaha jaha domestic connections kate hai
column7: karyakarta ek ek gali me jaaye aur connections jode.”

column2: sans-serif;"">
sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font face=""Calibri""><font size=""3"">Challenging Shiela Dikshit
column3: he said
column4: “<i>Jin jin garibo ke gharo me Shiela Dikshit ne andhera failaya hai
column5: un sabhi ke gharo me jaake roshini failayenge. Shiela Dikshit ko main ye challenge karta hun ki jitni apni police ki force hai utni laga do
column6: har gali me unhe tainat kar do. Junta ab bijli jodegi.”

column2: sans-serif;"">
sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">Explaining the significance of April 6th
column3: Manish Sisodia said that in the 1930s salt was an essential commodity which was being used by Government and capitalists to earn profits. Like salt then
column4: power and water in Delhi today have also become extremely essential commodities
column5: which is being used by crony capitalists like Reliance to earn huge profits and the Delhi Government on its part is tight lipped after getting commissions.

column2: sans-serif;"">

sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font face=""Calibri""><font size=""3"">Arvind Kejriwal said that around 9 lakh people have written to Sheila Dikshit saying that they would not be paying the bills
column3: but the fear of disconnection of power-water supply has not been fully erased from their minds and hearts. He asked AAP volunteers to create a list of all those households whose electricity connection has been disconnected by discoms so far and intensify the campaign for reconnecting supply from April 6</font><font><sup>th</sup></font><font size=""3"">onwards. Once we stand with people and connect their supplies
column4: this would boost their confidence further to stand up against tyrannical law.

column2: sans-serif;"">
sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;"">False Statements by BSES CEOs and Power Minister of Delhi
sans-serif;"">

sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">The Delhi Government and Discoms are together misleading people against Civil Disobedience movement and hiding the truth behind inflated electricity bills. In an attempt to discredit the movement
column3: the companies have claimed that they have received 100% payments for the month of March. This seems next to impossible as no service provider gets 100% collections for its services – there is always a gap. Set aside our movement
column4: even during normal time it is unlikely that these Discoms get 100% payments from consumers. We challenge these companies to disclose the figure of how many people have actually not paid their bills. This figure will reveal the actual impact of the movement.

column2: sans-serif;"">

sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">The Discoms claim that they purchase electricity at higher prices due to which the price of electricity is high in Delhi. This is completely false. We challenge them to disclose the complete data of purchase of power for Delhi including from whom they bought electricity
column3: at what rate
column4: to whom they sold surplus power and at what rate? This data will reveal the truth behind this argument.

column2: sans-serif;"">

sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">The companies have claimed that they are ready for CAG audit but there is no such law. This is also completely false as the law says that State Government can ask for a CAG audit. For any organisation
column3: which has substantial funding from the government
column4: in this case 49% share in the discoms is held by the Delhi Government and they were given thousands of crores of free assets by the Government. Despite the DERC and the CAG itself recommending CAG audits of Discoms
column5: the Sheila Dikshit led Delhi Government as refused to order that forcing RWAs to file a petition in the high Court for such an CAG audit. Infact
column6: the Congress Spokesman Abishek Manu Singhvi appeared for Reliance to oppose CAG audit. Even the Delhi Government was tacitly supporting the discoms in this.

column2: sans-serif;"">
sans-serif; margin: 0cm 0cm 10pt; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">The CAG Act clearly mentions that
column3: but the Government seems to be least interested. This means that there is collusion between Shiela Dikshit Government and Discoms. If the records are clear
column4: then why are they afraid of getting themselves audited?

column1: 104;"Press Update: Arvind Kejriwal to break his upwas tomorrow at 5 pm";"
column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">Announcing that he would end his upwas tomorrow
column3: Arvind Kejriwal said
column4: “For the first time such a huge door-to-door referendum has been undertaken in Independent India
column5: where more than 10.52 lakh people have registered their protest on a single issue. People of Delhi have expressed their agony on the rising prices of bijli and pani in the capital and signed on protest letters to Shiela Diskhit pledging that they would not pay their inflated bills.”

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font face=""Calibri""><font size=""3"">He further said that from tomorrow onwards
column3: Civil Disobedience movement launched by Aam aadmi Party would enter into the second phase. Bijli-pani connections of households whose connections were disconnected due to non-payment of inflated bills would be restored to take the fear out of the hearts and minds of delhi-ites against government and private companies. Explaining the importance of April 6th i.e. tomorrow he said
column4: <i>“April 6
column5: 1930 ko Gandhiji ne namak aandolan shuru kiya tha. Kal humara bhi aandolan dusre charan me jayega. Meri Delhi se appeal hai ki saare galivale milkar jao aur jin jinki bijli kati hai unka connection jod do. Karyakarta se appeal hai ki apne ward me jaaye
column6: vaha ke logo ko ikatha kare aur jinka connection kata hai unka connection vaha ke hi logo dwara judvaye. Isse logo ke man ka darr nikalega. Kal April 6 hai
column7: shubh din hai
column8: kal sham ko 5 baje main apna upwas tod dunga.”

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">Emphasising that though his upwas would end tomorrow but the aandolan would continue
column3: he said <i>“Kal ke baad bhi humare karyakarta har itvaar ko gali gali jayenge apne ward me
column4: aur har us gharka jiska connection kata hai
column5: uska connection jodenge. Hum janta ke sath unke har such dukh me khade honge. Kal mera upwas khatam hoga
column6: lekin ye aandolan zari rahega…..Ye ek tarah se bahut bada referendum hai. Par zada badi baat ye hai ki hum iske dwara garib se garib
column7: antim aadmi tak pahuch paye hai.”

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">He said
column3: he does not expect that all 10.5 lakh people who have signed the protest letters would not pay their bills
column4: but this shows the anger and frustration of people. In several places where we went
column5: one person in one family signed the letters. This means
column6: that the total number of people the movement has reached out to is 30-35 lakhs. This figure indicates that entire Delhi is suffering due to inflated bijli-pani bills. In last elections
column7: Shiela Diskhit received roughly 25 lakh votes. Arvind Kejriwal urged Shiela Dikshit to listen to the voice of people if she believes in democracy and reduce the tariff of bijli and pani in the Capital.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font face=""Calibri""><font size=""3"">Anna Hazare in a letter appealed to Arvind Kejriwal to end his upwas. In his letter he appealed
column3: <i>“Zada samay anshan na kare
column4: tandarust hoke fir desh ke liye kaam karenge. Yatra ke karan me nahi aa pa raha. Lekin me dil se keh raha hun ki aap ab anshan tod de."

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font face=""Calibri""><font size=""3"">Earlier in the day
column3: a sarva dharma prarthna was held today in Sunder Nagri. People attended the prarthna sabha in large numbers.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;""><font size=""3""><font face=""Calibri"">On 14th day of upwas
column3: Arvind Kejriwal blood pressure in the morning was 110/80
column4: pulse 73
column5: Sugar 123
column6: ketones 3+ and weight was 56.5 kgs.

column2: sans-serif; text-align: justify;"">

column1: 105;"ARVIND KEJRIWAL BREAKS UPWAS AFTER 15 DAYS";"<span style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column2: sans-serif; border-collapse: collapse; "">ARVIND KEJRIWAL BREAKS UPWAS AFTER 15 DAYS

column1: ANNOUNCES TO REDUCE BIJLI BILLS BY HALF AND 20 KILOLITERS OF WATER FREE WHEN AAP COMES TO POWER
Ending his 15-day upwas at Sundar Nagri today
column2: Arvind Kejriwal declared that the core agenda of next Delhi elections would be bijli and pani.  He said that parties which cannot even ensure bijli and pani for its people
column3: have no right to be in power. Declaring his fast as 15-day tapasya
column4: he said the fast has been successful in achieving its target of removing fear from the hearts of people.

column1: He said
column2: “<i>Congress and BJP is desh ki samasya ban chuki hai
column3: aur Aam Aadmi Party iska samadhan ki umeed hai.” Reacting strongly to those who criticised his fast he said
column4: <i>“Satta ke bhuke log
column5: 15 din tak bhuke baithkar tapasya nahi kar sakte.” He said that the politics of this country would no longer be run by crony capitalists but by people like those living in Sunder Nagri.

column1: Arvind Kejriwal broke his upwas at around 4pm in Sundar Nagri today by sipping coconut water from the hands of 8-year old Neeru and two other children from Sunder Nagri. Addressing a large gathering at Sunder Nagri he said
column2: “<i>Delhi ki janta ko ye samaj aane laga hai ki Congress aur BJP ek hi sikke ke do pehlu hai. Congress party Ambani se milke bijli-pani ke daam badhati hai
column3: aur BJP iska virodh karne ka natak karti hai.”

column1: Promising to reduce the prices of electricity by half when Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) comes to power in November Arvind Kejriwal said
column2: <i>“Shiela Dikshit baar baar keh rahi hai ki unhone Delhi me 24 ghante bijli ki supply di. Ye Shiela Dikshit ke vajah se nahi
column3: private companies ke vajah se nahi
column4: balki isliye hai kyunki naye naye power stations bane hai. November me jab Aam Aadmi Party ki sarkar banegi
column5: hum Delhi me bills adhe karenge.”

column1: Emphasizing that CAG audits of all these firms would be conducted
column2: he asked
column3: “<i>Shiela Dikshit kehti hai ki ye companiya CAG Audit nahi karva rahi hai. Kya Shiela Dikshit gulam hai in companies ki? Jab AAP ki sarkar ayegi
column4: tab in sabka audit karvaegi. Agar ye companiya audit karvane se mana karde to inka license cancel karva diya jayega aur  take over kar liya jayega.”

column1: On the question that private companies might file complaints against those who do not pay the bills he said
column2: when AAP comes to power all such cases would be waived off. Warning the private companies not to harass people till November
column3: he said if the companies do so then Prashant Bhushan has constituted a team of lawyers which would fight cases for the poor people free of cost.

column1: Speaking about inflated water bills due to corruption
column2: he said
column3: “Kal DJB ke kai log aye the. Humne calculation ki to pata chala ki Delhi me 20 Kiloliter paani muft diya ja sakta hai. Iska kharcha karib 460 crore ayega. Ye 460 crore kaha se ayega? Delhi ke Malviya Nagar me thore din pehle 519 crore ka ek farzi theka diya hai. Nangloi me 3500 crore ka farzi theka diya hai. Ye 460 crore vaha se ayega. Delhi me hum 20 Kiloliter paani tak muft denge.”

column1: In the last 3-4 months
column2: our volunteers who have gone door-to-door have found that poor people are getting false and highly inflated water bills - poor people are being looted. When Aam Aadmi Party comes to power
column3: we would waive off water bills
column4: excluding that of very rich people. The money that is saved by curbing corruption in Delhi Jal Board would be utilised for this.

column1: On his future plans for ensuring water supply in Delhi he said
column2: “<i>Delhi ke andar jal swaraaj laaya jayega .Delhi me itni baarish hai
column3: paani ka sanrakshan karenge. Paani khud banayenge. Iska detailed proposal bana rahe hai.”

column1: He said more than 10.5 lakh people had registered their protest against inflated bijli pani bills
column2: which Shiela Dikshit had refused to accept. He said
column3: “<i>28 april ko Jantar Mantar par milenge. Shiela Dikshit apne 4 clerk Jantar Mantar par bheje aur ye letters collect karyave. Nahi to hum Shiela Dikshit ke ghar ke taraf jayenge
column4: chahe police dande kyu na barsaye.”

column1: Earlier in the morning today
column2: Aam Aadmi Party activists restored power connections of more than 150 households whose connection was disconnected all across Delhi. From Kirari to Babarpur
column3: from Trilok Puri to RK Puram - connections were restored in all parts of Delhi. In Naraina''s Sanjay Camp area
column4: Ramakant Goswami (Delhi Cabinet Minister) and Congress Councillor Sandeep Tanwar came with 40-50 people and tried to scare people saying that they would have to face action if they re-connect the supply. The local people who had gathered there not only booed them away but also restored power connection of 3 jhuggis.

column1: From morning onwards
column2: rallies took off in more than 60+ vidhan sabhas
column3: going street by street restoring power connections.

column1: In Daryaganj
column2: 20 year old Seema lives in a small shanty with 4 family members - all younger brothers and sisters. Since her parents expired she works as a domestic help and manages to earn around Rs 2000 per month. She received a bill of Rs 2400 last month. On non-payment
column3: her connection was disconnected. AAP volunters today restored her connection.

column1: In New Kondli area
column2: Kumar Vishwas and Manish Sisodia restored connection of Mr. Param Hans
column3: who had received a bill of Rs. 24000. He irons clothes for a living. His electricity had been disconnected for the past 5 months. When someone asked what if the power companies file an complaint against him
column4: he said
column5: "We hardly live a good life right now. What maximum can the power companies do? Put us in jail? No matter what I will fight and we will not pay the bill anymore. I am with Aam Aadmi Party now"

column1: Though Arvind Kejriwal’s upwas has ended the aandolan against bijli-pani bills would continue. On April 28th we would assemble again at Jantar Mantar to deliver the letters to Shiela Dikshit.
106;"Manish Sisodia''s Reaction to Ajit Pawar’s Statement";"<span style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column2: sans-serif; border-collapse: collapse; "">

column1: The statement made by Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar today is extremely shameful. The statement is an insult not only to the people of Maharashtra but also to the people of the entire country. It is sheer arrogance of power
column2: knowing fully well that no action would be taken against him for such a shocking statement. This only proves further that all the parties
column3: be it Congress
column4: BJP
column5: NCP or be it any other party are all together in looting the people of the nation. Aam Aadmi Party not only condemns the statement made by Pawar today but also demands his immediate resignation.

column1: -- Manish Sisodia
107;"Aam Aadmi Party''s Statement on Appointment of NHRC members and Allegation that Rajiv Gandhi acted as middleman in defence deals";"<span style=""color: #222222; font-family: arial
column2: sans-serif; border-collapse: collapse; "">

column1: STATEMENT ON PROPOSED APPOINTMENT OF JUSTICE CYRIAC JOSEPH AND SC SINHA TO NHRC
The government''s efforts to push through the appointments of Justice Cyriac Joseph and former NIA director S.C. Sinha to the NHRC
column2: shows the determination of the government to render this watchdog institution ineffective and also compromise the Independence of the Judiciary and investigative bodies like the NIA. Justice Cyriac Joseph is reported to have an intelligence report against him. Apart from that
column3: he has an ignominious record of hardly writing any judgements during his tenure in the Court. He kept judgments pending for years
column4: including the important judgment on Mulayam Singh''s disproportionate assets
column5: which he did not deliver at all
column6: which suited this government well. Rewarding such non performing judges with such post retirement jobs not only compromises the Independence and effectiveness of the NHRC but also of the judiciary. Similarly
column7: the proposed appointment of the former director of the NIA to the NHRC is in line with this government''s policy of handing plum post retirement jobs to directors of the CBI and other important investigative agencies
column8: which is designed to compromise their Independence.

column1: The government''s attempt to destroy the Independence of the NHRC is clear from their steadfast refusal to even refer 5 serious charges of misconduct including disproportionate assets against the Chairman NHRC
column2: Justice Balakrishnan to the Supreme Court for investigation for 2 years in violation of the NHRC Act and in defiance of the orders of the Supreme Court. This is how they are controlling the NHRC and seek to control the proposed Lokpal as well. That is why the appointment and removal process of members of such watchdog institutions must be made Independent of the government as proposed in the Jan Lokpal bill.

column1: ON ALLEGATION THAT RAJIV GANDHI ACTED AS MIDDLEMEN IN DEFENCE DEALS
It has been reported in The Hindu today that Rajiv Gandhi might have acted as a middle-man in defence deal involving purchase of Viggen fighter aircraft by Swedish company Saab-Scania in the 1970s
column2: much before he became the Prime Minister. This has been revealed in Kissinger-era documents obtained by wiki-leaks.

column1: This is a very serious allegation against a former Prime Minister of the country
column2: and should be thoroughly investigated by an Independent investigative agency. But the question still remains— who would investigate into these allegations? Bofors scam involving another Swedish company led to the downfall of Rajiv Gandhi led Congress government in 1989. But due to lack of independent investigation there has been practically no progress in that case. In this present case also
column3: even if a CBI investigation is ordered
column4: it would just drag on for many years until it is lost in the maze of biased investigation
column5: bureaucracy and judiciary. This is why Aam Aadmi Party has been demanding an independent Lokpal on the lines of Jan Lokpal
column6: which would include Prime Minister under its ambit.

column1:
It is however unrealistic to expect this corrupt government to this. The people of the country will give a fitting reply to this government in the next election.

108;"Aam Aadmi Party stands in solidarity with Medha Patkar and activists of Ghar Bachao Ghar Banao Andolan on their indefinite fast to protest against unjust demolition of slums in Mumbai.";"<span style=""font-family: arial
column2: sans-serif;"">Aam Aadmi Party stands in solidarity with Medha Patkar and activists of Ghar Bachao Ghar Banao Andolan on their indefinite fast to protest against unjust demolition of slums in Mumbai because of the corruption and nexus between the Government and Builders under the cover of the Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA). Slum Rehabilitation has become one of the biggest scams in Mumbai as Government has authorised private builders to redevelop slum land
column3: who are only interested in freeing up those land and selling it off in the property market for huge sum of money. This has led to lakhs of low-income families living in slums struggling for their basic right to a house.

column1: We endorse the andolan''s demand that the work in all these SRA projects should be stopped until the report of the enquiry
column2: under the chairmanship of Principal secretary - Housing
column3: which is in progress since 13th January 2013
column4: is completed and actions taken on those recommendations. Government has betrayed its earlier commitment to the affected people and has recently let demolition drive proceed while enquiry is yet to complete. We demand that the Government sticks to its promise and do a thorough and transparent enquiry in this matter.
